conbody.p: The main components used in SAP Vora are described briefly in the table below.

row.entry: Component
Description
Vora Tools
An SQL editor, data browser, and view modeling environment.
Spark Thrift Server
The Hive/Thrift Query Server handles incoming JDBC requests for Spark SQL queries. It is in charge of creating and handling the Spark session required to run Spark SQL queries.
SAP Vora Spark Extension

The SAP Vora Spark extension implements the Spark data source API to enable access to SAP HANA and SAP Vora tables and views through Spark SQL. The SAP Vora Spark extension communicates with the transaction coordinator or SAP HANA to execute queries on data stored in SAP HANA or the various SAP Vora engines.
Transaction Coordinator
The transaction coordinator controls the execution of queries on the graph, disk, document, and time series engines on behalf of the SAP Vora Spark extension.
Catalog Server

The SAP Vora catalog provides a distributed metadata store. It stores changes to the metadata in the DLog Server. The catalog keeps metadata about the database objects (tables, time series, graphs, document collections) stored in the various SAP Vora engines.
Landscape Manager
The landscape manager controls data partitioning and placement across database engines.
Transaction Broker
The transaction broker provides a read-write lock mechanism for DDL statements. This ensures that both the catalog and instances of the query engine keep a consistent state at all times.
Discovery Service

The Discovery Service manages the service endpoints in the cluster. These include the SAP Vora catalog, SAP Vora engines, DLog, and others. It runs health checks on all registered services at pre-defined intervals.
Cluster Manager/Kubernetes Dashboard
The Kubernetes dashboard is used to run all SAP Vora services on a cluster of compute nodes. It allows you to deploy, maintain, and monitor the SAP Vora services.
DLog (Distributed Log)
The distributed log manager provides metadata persistence for the SAP Vora catalog.
SAP Vora Engines

The SAP Vora engines provide specialized storage and processing capabilities for relational, graph, time series, and document data. The engines communicate with each other during data partitioning and query processing.
HDFS
The Hadoop Distributed File System is a virtualized file system with replication and block-wise storage.
S3
The Amazon Simple Storage Service provides an object store, from which the SAP Vora engines can read data.
ADL
The Azure Data Lake Storage (ADL) provides a cloud storage service with an HDFS API.
WASB
The Windows Azure Storage Block (WASB) infrastructure is a HDFS-based cloud store.
GCS
GCS is the Google Cloud Store.
Node Storage/Local FS
The local file system attached to the Kubernetes pods. It is used by the relational disk engine and DLog to store (cached) data.
HANA SDA
SAP HANA Smart Data Access. An SAP HANA query federation technology that can be configured to federate queries across SAP HANA and SAP Vora.
Spark Clients (Livy, Thrift Server, Spark Shell)
Spark clients that run Spark applications using Spark submit. Spark clients can be configured to use the SAP Vora Spark extension for communication with SAP Vora.
